poem:
### Political Fracture

In the thicket of politics  
sharp words pierce—  
Lowe and Farage flare  
like autumn leaves in wind.  
Accusations—a flurry of letters,  
each one a pin  
pricking the air.  
Truth scatters  
in the hustling breeze,  
the paper's ink  
a fleeting shadow,  
messianic and blue.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Divided Reform UK reports own MP to police amid bullying claims Reform UK has erupted into open civil war after the party said its MP Rupert Lowe had received complaints about bullying and had made threats against the party chair, a day after Lowe criticised Nigel Farage for being “messianic”. Lowe responded with anger, saying there was no evidence to back up the bullying claims, and that it was “entirely untrue” that he had made". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
